snippet: AntiSec, a subset of the loose hacking collective known as Anonymous, claims to have obtained the records by hacking into the laptop of a Federal Bureau of Investigation agent.
abstract: AntiSec, a subset of the loose hacking collective known as Anonymous, claims to have obtained the records by hacking into the laptop of a Federal Bureau of Investigation agent.

snippet: Apple issued invitations for an event next week where it is expected to introduce its next iPhone. The invitation's vague teaser says, "It's almost here."
abstract: Apple issued invitations for an event next week where it is expected to introduce its next iPhone. The invitation's vague teaser says, "It's almost here."

snippet: Nest Labs makes a smart thermostat that promotes energy saving by studying homeowners’ habits and predicting what they are likely to do with their home heating and cooling.
abstract: Nest Labs makes a smart thermostat that promotes energy saving by studying homeowners’ habits and predicting what they are likely to do with their home heating and cooling.

headline.main: Big Data in the (Heated or Cooled) Air Around You

snippet: Stocks were narrowly mixed in uncommitted trade on the first day of business day after a holiday, and seemed likely to stay muddled until Thursday’s meeting of the European Central Bank.
abstract: Stocks are narrowly mixed on the first business day after the Labor Day holiday, and seem likely to stay muddled until midweek meeting of the European Central Bank.

headline.main: Mired Shares Await Word on Europe

snippet: The Zooka from Carbon Audio is a bar-shaped wireless speaker designed to slide onto the edge of a MacBook or iPad.

snippet: 8:00 p.m. | Updated Hackers released a file that they said contained a million identification numbers for  Apple  mobile devices, claiming that they had obtained it by hacking into the computer of an  F.B.I.  agent. The F.B.I. said it had no evide...
abstract: Hacking group AntiSec, a subset of the loose collective Anonymous, releases a file that they say contains a million identification numbers for Apple mobile devices, claiming that they had obtained it by hacking into the computer of an Federal Bureau of Investigation agent; security experts say that the release, while appearing to be authentic, poses little risk. (M)

headline.main: Hackers Post ID Numbers for Apple Devices, Claiming They Are From F.B.I.
